sns.countplot(y=y,label='count')

print('year:2009,generation:G.I. Generation ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2009) & (data['generation'] == 'G.I. Generation')]['age'].values))
print('year:2009,generation:Silent ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2009) & (data['generation'] == 'Silent')]['age'].values))
print('year:2009,generation:Boomers ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2009) & (data['generation'] == 'Boomers')]['age'].values))
print('year:2009,generation:Generation X ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2009) & (data['generation'] == 'Generation X')]['age'].values))
print('year:2009,generation:Millenials ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2009) & (data['generation'] == 'Millenials')]['age'].values))
print('year:2009,generation:Generation Z ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2009) & (data['generation'] == 'Generation Z')]['age'].values))
print('-'*100)
print('year:2010,generation:G.I. Generation ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2010) & (data['generation'] == 'G.I. Generation')]['age'].values))
print('year:2010,generation:Silent ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2010) & (data['generation'] == 'Silent')]['age'].values))
print('year:2010,generation:Boomers ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2010) & (data['generation'] == 'Boomers')]['age'].values))
print('year:2010,generation:Generation X ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2010) & (data['generation'] == 'Generation X')]['age'].values))
print('year:2010,generation:Millenials ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2010) & (data['generation'] == 'Millenials')]['age'].values))
print('year:2010,generation:Generation Z ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2010) & (data['generation'] == 'Generation Z')]['age'].values))
print('-'*100)
print('year:2011,generation:G.I. Generation ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2011) & (data['generation'] == 'G.I. Generation')]['age'].values))
print('year:2011,generation:Silent ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2011) & (data['generation'] == 'Silent')]['age'].values))
print('year:2011,generation:Boomers ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2011) & (data['generation'] == 'Boomers')]['age'].values))
print('year:2011,generation:Generation X ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2011) & (data['generation'] == 'Generation X')]['age'].values))
print('year:2011,generation:Millenials ',np.unique(data[(data['year'] == 2011) & (data['generation'] == 'Millenials')]['age'].values))

source.8ab1483a:
year_list = list(range(1985,2017))
for i in year_list:
    print('year:{},generation:G.I. Generation {}'.format(i,np.unique(data[(data['year'] == i) & (data['generation'] == 'G.I. Generation')]['age'].values)))
    print('year:{},generation:Silent {}'.format(i,np.unique(data[(data['year'] == i) & (data['generation'] == 'Silent')]['age'].values)))
    print('year:{},generation:Boomers {}'.format(i,np.unique(data[(data['year'] == i) & (data['generation'] == 'Boomers')]['age'].values)))
    print('year:{},generation:Generation X {}'.format(i,np.unique(data[(data['year'] == i) & (data['generation'] == 'Generation X')]['age'].values)))
    print('year:{},generation:Millenials {}'.format(i,np.unique(data[(data['year'] == i) & (data['generation'] == 'Millenials')]['age'].values)))
    print('year:{},generation:Generation Z {}'.format(i,np.unique(data[(data['year'] == i) & (data['generation'] == 'Generation Z')]['age'].values)))
    print('-'*100)

source.4246be1c:
# Introduction
This kernel explored the data set about suicide.  
Basically I tried to visualize data using Seaborn.  
I will add some predictions using machine learning afterwards.  
This kernel is **yet incomplete**.  
Even so, if you like it, please **upvote**.  
Your one click makes me very happy.

## Notebook Outline

1.  [**Data Load**](#Data-Load)   
2. [**Visualization**](#Visualization)  
    2-1 [**Number of suicides by gender**](#Number-of-suicides-by-gender)  
    2-2 [**Number of suicide by age**](#Number-of-suicide-by-age)  
    2-3 [**Number of suicides by generation**](#Number-of-suicides-by-generation)  
    2-4 [**Population by gender**](#Population-by-gender)  
    2-5 [**Population by age**](#Population-by-age)  
    2-6 [**Population by generation**](#Population-by-generation)  
    2-7 [**Suicide per 100,000 people by gender**](#Suicide-per-100,000-people-by-gender)  
    2-8 [**Suicide per 100,000 people by age**](#Suicide-per-100,000-people-by-age)  
    2-9 [**Suicide per 100,000 people by generation**](#Suicide-per-100,000-people-by-generation)  
    2-10 [**HDI by country**](#HDI-by-country)  
    2-11 [**GDP for year by country**](#GDP-for-year-by-country)  
    2-12 [**GDP per capita by country**](#GDP-per-capita-by-country)  
    2-13 [**Correlation between suicides/100k_pop and HDI**](#Correlation-between-suicides/100k_pop-and-HDI)  
    2-14 [**Correlation between suicides/100k_pop and GDP for year**](#Correlation-between-suicides/100k_pop-and-GDP-for-year)  
    2-15 [**Correlation between suicides/100k_pop and GDP per capita**](#Correlation-between-suicides/100k_pop-and-GDP-per-capita)  
3. [**Conclusion**](#Conclusion)
source.02c4542d:
First of all, I'll look at the number of data in each country.  
**It is the number of data, not the number of suicides.  **
source.ae48cd6a:
# Conclusion
Through the data visualization, the following three points were clarified. 

1. Men are more suicidal than women.   
2. The people at age of 35-54 years suicide most. However, in the suicide per 100,000 people, the people at ages over 75 suicide most.   
3. When GDP is low, the number of suicide increases.  

I will add prediction using machine learning to this kernel soon.   
If you find something useful here, please upvote :)
source.2bb869ea: As described above, there are many men suicide in per 100,000 people as well.

source.60d0cf7e:
I would like to summarize the columns definition as below.  
**【Columns Definition】  **  
- year…Christian era.  
- age…The age is summarized within a certain range.  
    - 5-14 years
    - 15-24 years
    - 25-34 years
    - 35-54 years
    - 55-74 years
    - 75+ years
- suicides_no…Number of suicidals.   
- suicides/100k pop …Suicide by population of 100,000 people.    
- country-year…Combination of country and year.    
- HDI for year…The Human Development Index (HDI) is a simple indicator for measuring the average degree of accomplishment in a country regarding three aspects of human development: health, education, and income. 
- generation…Generations in America.  
    - G.I. Generation…1900 - 1924  
    - Silent…1925 - 1942  
    - Boomers…1946 - 1964  
    - Generation X …1965 - 1980    
    - Millenials…1981 - 2000  
    - Generation Z…2001 - 2010

source.acf947a8:
* 1991:  
    * 55-74 years : G.I Generations → Silent  
    * 5-14years : Generation X → Millenials  
* 1995:  
    * 25-34 years : Boomers → Generation X  
* 2001:  
    * 75+ years : G.I. Generation → Silent  
    * 15-24 years : Generation X → Millenials  
* 2007:  
    * 5-14 years : Millenials→Generation Z  
* 2010:  
    * 35-54 years : Boomers → Generation X  
* 2011:  
    * 55-74 years : Silent → Boomers  
    * 25-34 years : Generation X → Millenials
